website_summaries.verdict: A low-priced nail gun. The quality of this product surprises and delights budget-focused consumers.
cons: Requires an air compressor to operate

website_summaries.verdict: Very low price for a brad nailer. Lightweight body makes it easy to use this tool all day long.
pros: Supports 18-gauge brad nails ranging from 0.75 inches to 2 inches
Handle has rubber grip for excellent handling and comfort
Oil and adjustment wrenches are included, making this low-priced tool an even better value
Can direct the exhaust to avoid air in your face
cons: Probably not powerful enough for certain construction jobs

customer_reviews.title: A true bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Adding my voice to the chorus. This thing is way better than it should be at the price. Works flawlessly, no misfeeds, and someone writing the manuals had a sense of humor (see picture).
customer_reviews.author: J. Jerome

customer_reviews.title: how good could it be
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't want to buy it because it was so inexpensive. I mean, how good could it be? I have no regrets, we just hung an entire wall of shiplap with this and I have nothing but good things to say about the product. No misfires, no double nails, no issues what so ever. If you need a nail gun, just go ahead and buy it. Save yourself some money, you don't need anything more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDude

customer_reviews.title: I don't know why I waited so long to get one!
customer_reviews.text: Some hammers cost more than this brad nailer! If you have an air compressor, and don't have a brad nailer, it's time to get one. I renovated our master bed room, and mounted all of the casing, baseboard trim, crown molding, and bed molding in our new tray ceiling - all with this nailer! It comes with oil too! Never jammed, and I only had to use a nail set on 2 or 3 brads (probably because I didn't have the nailer angled correctly.) Ordered it with a variety pack of brads. () Love them too! PS. Got the bed on amazon, too () as well as the bedding, nightstand, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sj773Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Quality nailer~Great price
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid DIY-er and spend a lot of time making things and remodeling our home. This nailer does the job! It is easy to use and so far I haven't had any problems with it. I have yet to find a project that I can't do with this. I only wish I would have bought this sooner. The price was unbelievable, I figured it wouldn't be very good since the price was so low. The price was cheap but the quality of the nailer is not. It's not professional grade but I'm not a professional. It's perfect for what I needed it for. Thanks Amazon and Wen!
customer_reviews.author: Marriedasouthernman

customer_reviews.title: Buy quality, which isn't this nailer
customer_reviews.text: Problems - multiple brads nailed randomly, despite very delicate trigger management. Brads come out at unpredictable angles. lubricant passes through gun, you need to nail a dozen brads to clean out even a couple of drops of oil. And, lastly, this broke after only low to moderate use. I replaced this with a DeWalt nailer, which was much more expensive, but vastly better quality. And, has a seven year guarantee. I had to interrupt my project and send a son on a three hour round trip to replace this after it broke. What's that worth?
customer_reviews.author: John D. Fry

customer_reviews.title: Looks good  does not perform well
customer_reviews.text: Based on the previous reviews (glowing) i decided to take a chance. I have run 200 1 inch brads through the device, with poor results. I had 2 instances of jamming, multiple instances of double shots, and one triple fire. I adjusted the air pressure from 60 to 100 psi which had no impact on the performance. I ruined several pieces of work, as a result of these issues. Maybe i got the bad one, or maybe its a case of getting what one pays for. This cost less than getting my old Porter Cable repaired, guess I just need to get the Porter Cable fixed i don't need the aggravation!
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: My first air nailer
customer_reviews.text: It came in a nice plastic case and included oil. I used it to quickly tack together a box. I plan to use to temporarily fasten together wood working projects until I can use a stronger permanent solution like screws or biscuits. The price is incredible and the tool quality is outstanding. I was using 1 3/4" Hitachi 18 gauge brad nails. I was getting full penetration below surface of about 2 or 3 mm at 100 psi, which is what I wanted. I'm very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Fender

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this nailer
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this nailer, I would gladly spend twice as much. I've been using mine for a few months now with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: lee c.

customer_reviews.title: Jams after every fire
customer_reviews.text: Uhg. It's so frustrating when a brand new tool doesn't operate correctly. This nailer is jamming after every single 2" brad. Every time, straight out of the box. This one is going back to where it came from. Update: I replaced this nailer with a Porter Cable 2" brad nailer which worked beautifully. Maybe some of the Wen nailers are fine, but the one I received just didn't work properly. It's nice to have tools that work the way they are meant to work.
customer_reviews.author: tylioromiosaurus

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate!!! Love this heavy-duty brad nailer.
customer_reviews.text: First time I used a brad nailer and I want to nail everything now. Not only is it heavy duty, it is also very lightweight and compact. It comes with a case and it lets you use multiple brad nails (From 3/4"-2"). Dont wait it's $19 dollars and it bumps with those $99+ brad nailers. Used for: Indoor/Outdoor trim.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Pimentel

customer_reviews.title: Drives brads perfectly for trim & molding
customer_reviews.text: This nailer replaces an older Senco that I used for over 30 years. Sadly, the headless nails for the Senco are in limited supply, and the size I needed for my latest project are no longer available. Based on reviews, I figured I would try the Wen. I have not been disappointed. The unit was easy to adjust for depth of set, and the headless brads I purchased worked as expected for the installation of baseboards and quarter round molding. Setting depth was consistent. No jams. No mis-fires. Even if it lasts 1/2 as long as my Senco, I won't be disappointed ;-). Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT staple capable
customer_reviews.text: When searching for an "air" or "pneumatic" stapler, this nailer is one of the top recommendations that Amazon gives you. The problem is it is NOT a 2-1 stapler/nailer, even though it looks identical to other 2-1 stapler/nailers on the market (and on Amazon). It only uses brad nails; NOT staples. I gave it 3 stars only because of Amazon's search engine's grouping it with other similar products that are staplers. It's not the product's fault and I'm reluctant to mark it down simply because Amazon's search engine is flawed. I'm sure it works just fine as a brad nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Melsman

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: I am a hobbyist and bought this as my first brad nailer. I was impressed to a point, but also disappointed. I used this over a few days while putting together a project. I found that there are a few times that I shoot and only air comes out. I shoot again, and the nail makes it. This seems to have happened quite a few times. Maybe even a few times that I didn't notice. For the price, I'd say if you are hobbyist, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great function
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price with this, but you'd be hard pressed to beat the product itself. Gets the job done! I purchased to hand plywood strips for a faux plank wall, and have run over 1,000 brads through it with no problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. I'm using it for trim and with a short calibration test I'm rocking and rolling. I did have one jam within the first 100 I fired. That's not why I gave this 4 stars instead of 5. The extra star could have been earned if the instructions were better. I'm completely new to pneumatic tools and have some trouble loading. I didn't understand that the little tab on the moveable side of the magazine compresses the nails. I snapped up a couple nail belts before figuring it out. The jam clearing instructions were fine.
customer_reviews.author: R H.

customer_reviews.title: Great little nailer for the DIY'r
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit several years ago, and I use it fairly often on household projects, woodworking projects, etc. Back when I bought it, I admittedly bought it because I was on a much stricter budget than I would typically consider now, and this one was super affordable. That siad, I've bought a few other WEN products because I've had such good luck with this one. WEN is a great budget brand. No complaints whatsoever with this unit. Heck, I've only had one single jam with this. ONE. Crazy for how much I've used it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Dramatic time saver over hammer and nails
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and lightweight. First time user of a power nailer and it made installing trim easily 10x faster. Paired with a low noise compressor and a light weight hose, you can cut your time and aggravation. So far only 200 brads used but zero jams or problems. If you’ve EVER fought with small gauge nails and a hammer installing trim you don’t know how much better this makes the job. Hold the trim in place, a tap of the trigger, and move on to the next nail point. No more bent nails, no more smashed fingers, just tap and move.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Purvey

customer_reviews.title: Inexperienced Users...!!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, for the record, I’ve got a few construction projects I'm darned proud of... namely specially sized shelves and toy furniture for my special needs kiddo... my tween who loves all things sized for preschool play. If you saw somebody building a macdaddy project on Youtube using a brad nailer, go back and look again. Apparently this also requires ownership of an air compressor. oh stop laughing, pros... i said this is only for inexperienced users! 👷‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Prime Addict

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the process of adding new crown molding to the tops of my kitchen cabinets. I was using my regular/framing nailer, but it was not driving the nails deep enough, forcing me to use a nail set, which then just knocked the molding out of alignment. Frustrated, I decided to do some research on Amazon and quickly decided on this Brad Nailer due to the positive reviews. It drives the nails in perfectly, I could not be happier with this product, and was amazed at the quality at this price point. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bellarmine22

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer for the money
customer_reviews.text: It did what I needed it to do. I don't need to use it much, so it's just what I needed. You probably wouldn't use this if you are a full time trim carpenter. The adjustment for how far it sinks the nails could use some calibration marks so you can reset to the same adjustment next time you have the same nail and wood type. I always tried a few sample shots to get it right. For the money it's hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: StreamReader

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Designed Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to nail down a floor. When the nails came out cleanly, it worked fine. However the product jammed constantly. And freeing it up took a lot of time. Probably 80% of the time was fixing jams. It got worse as the job went on (it was only about 300 square feet). I'd return it if I could but I see no option to (I ordered it a month or so before getting to use it) Not happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kelman

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Just a few days ago I gave this product a 5-star rating. Today it misfired and the brad nail is stuck in the tip of the gun. Try as I may, I can't get the nail out. I had a Porter Cable 2" brad nailer that worked perfectly for 15+ years. Unfortunately, I lost it and bought this piece of junk to replace it. I've had it for almost 4 months so I'm past the return deadline. Beware, this is a case of you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Brad Nailer
customer_reviews.text: This nailer looks to be adequately made however I have not used it yet. I have some trepidation as to using it considering there is no rubber guard on the actuator where it would have direct contact with the wood. Most manufacturers put a rubber guard there to keep from damaging the work piece but I will see how it goes. If it does damage the work piece I am working on, I will attempt to fashion some type of rubberized guard for it or I will throw the damn thing away.
customer_reviews.author: John Rhyne

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So far works great. I installed a pallet wall using this. This made the job way easier than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: NateB

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Possibly Beat the $$$ Value of This Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Faced with replacing a 20 year old nailer that died, I was looking at some high dollar units. I have found that Wen usually offers the best value tool for the price so I gave this a try. For a weekend warrior that uses this once a month I foresee this lasting another 20 years. It even includes the air fitting which EVERY other nailer omits. Well done Wen!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Mcafee

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tool to use for fixing some trim around the house and putting wood boards above the fireplace for a more rustic look. I've never used a brad nailer or air compressor before, and did have to do a little look-up on YouTube to be sure I was doing it properly, but the nailer worked great every time! I had no misfires, and no problems at all. The end does leave a small mark on softer wood, as noted in some other reviews, and the chamber doesn't hold a ton of nails (I had to refill once for a relatively small project). For less than $30, though, it worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: sarahz

customer_reviews.title: it can use shorter than 3/4 inch nails. solid tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool to do some work on a job site as the one i had from harbor freight failed and i needed something to get going on the job. points to note the depth adjuster is very simple, no tools required and it runs perfectly on about 60 psi. i also discovered that even though its listed as using 3/4-2 inch nails, i tried it with some 5/8 inch nails i had and it ran without any problems. its light weight and ease of use makes this tool a must have... think i'm gonna buy another one as spare to put down. real solid piece of tool, i definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gyles

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer
customer_reviews.text: My old nailer blew an o ring and is bypassing the air. Instead if buy an o ring kit, I decided to search for a replacement. Finding the Wen Brad nailer was even cheaper than the o ring kit. I failed to maintain my first nailer properly and did not oil it enough. When I got this nailer, it came with a bottle of oil. Perfect. Oil before and after use. No problems with nails I was using. It pins the nails a little hard, I set the air on 60 pounds. Depending on the wood, you may need to test it for better pressure requirements. I am very pleased with mine.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: I love this gun
customer_reviews.text: I'll be the first to admit that I was skeptical when I first saw the price of this gun and was concerned that it was a cheap piece of junk. But recently I've had bad luck with some name-brand guns so I thought why not try something less expensive and it turned out to be the best of what I've used recently. The more expensive gun I bought had a lot of plastic on it which lead two are falling apart after only owning it a few months. This Gun is solidly built. I use it a lot as professional woodworker and I've been very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: David w clinkinbeard

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: There are already video reviews on this, but I'll throw my review in too. It's cheap, it works, what more do you want? It comes with some oil, it has a nice case it comes in (I like when tools have the case to keep everything organized), it does the job and it's way cheaper than the name brands. This is a pretty safe purchase IMO, I highly doubt anyone would be really disappointed with this purchase, especially at the price point. Excellent little tool, I've had no malfunctions or troubles with this tool at all, it just works.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: this thing works GREAT. A few drops of oil before first use
customer_reviews.text: Ive never had a power nailer so I cant compare but Ive done a heck of a lot of projects over my lifetime and I must say, I wish I bought one of these sooner. this thing works GREAT. A few drops of oil before first use. load the nails and go like hell. Perfect trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Price/Quality, good Small Project & Home Brad Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the WEN Brad Nailer for making Targets for the gun range. The WEN Brad nailer did a great job making targets (from 1x1). I now use a Hitachi Stapler for making the Targets and attaching the Cardboard. The WEN Brad Nailer comes with a nice case, a couple of small Allen keys and a small bottle of lubricate. The WEN nailed works with Brad Nails up to 2 inches (which is what I used). For the price, I would stay the WEN Nailer is a steal. I recommend this WEN nailer a small project/home nailer, it more then means those needs.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Sayers

customer_reviews.title: What a dandy nailer!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace a porter cable that shot craps in the middle of a job. This one came fast (36 hrs). Out of box, out of nice plastic case, oiled and straight to work. No problems no hassles and handles and shoots with no problems. I was installing household wood trim and used 3/4; 1 1/4; and 2” brads with no failures or mishaps. This is a great gun and a great buy. I am going to try to put a cushion on the steel safety at the nose. But I also love the directional air discharge port.
customer_reviews.author: Zeroinlyndon

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: We actually got one of these in July 2017. It was $19.10 then. My husband has hung crown moulding, wainscoting, baseboards and other trim work. He has used the fool out of this thing! He would have never survived all the work he's done with a hammer and nails. God forbid, if it tore up tomorrow we've definitely got our monies worth. If it did tear up I'd buy another one in a minute. I've never used it, but I've seen the hubby in action and it's definately a big winner!
customer_reviews.author: Angie J H.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a nail gun to do shiplap with and the expensive ones are also huge and heavy. This nail gun is easy to use, and light enough for me to use by myself without having my husband do the projects for me. I recommend this for projects around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: I love this cheap tool. I've been using it for the past month installing baseboard and quarter round in my house. It works flawlessly not one jam. I'm a auto technician by trade so I know how to take care of air tools. I use a few drops of oil while holding the trigger so it gets inside the inner workings. I do this just about every other use. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: gary marrs

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for me
customer_reviews.text: My porter cable brad nailer quit firing (14 years old) and used it about 10 times in my life when I needed to install trim. I looked up the parts and they were $16 + $12 shipping = $28 plus the parts would take 4 days to get here and I’d have the hassle of fixing my old brad nailer. I decided to take a chance on this WEN brad nailer....it worked perfect. Hopefully when I have another project like this it works again. I experienced no issues. I fired only around 50 nails.
customer_reviews.author: MovieMike

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products that it's hard to believe you can buy something so well made, designed, and priced. I'm not a carpenter by any means, and that is exactly who this is made for. I don't suppose this would hold up too long for a professional, but for a part time carpenter/homeowner, this is perfect. I installed 400 feet of quarter round, with no issues, saving me hours. It paid for itself on the first job!
customer_reviews.author: ebb

customer_reviews.title: What else can you ask for
customer_reviews.text: Great little nailer for my little shop. Hooked it right up and went to work making my projects. Light and portable and easy to handle. The only thing I may complain about is the fact that the nail clips tend to beak apart when I load them. Pretty sure it is me just rushing and not taking my time, so its not really a knock on the unit. More of just be award and take your time loading the nails.
customer_reviews.author: Wannabedyi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing how well this works, considering the price.
customer_reviews.text: I am incredibly happy with this nail gun! I was worried that it would be a cheapo piece of junk and I was way wrong. I haven't had a single jam yet. I also found out that it will take shorter nails than indicated in the description. The exhaust being multi directional is a great feature because you never know what angle you will be shooting from and this makes it easy to always enjoy using this gun. I urge you to buy this gun. I use it for making pallet furniture and quick fixes around the house and it hasn't let me down once. If this review was helpful, please mark it as helpful below.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great for simple DIY projects
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to ship lap some of our home walls. It was priced very reasonably and the reviews were good so we went with it. It is very easy and simple to use and did just what we needed. It has worked every time we used it and have not had any issues whatsoever. It is easy to load new nails/brads and I like that it has a window in the sleeve so you can see how many are left. Would absolutely recommend to those doing simple DIY projects especially ship lap.
customer_reviews.author: ScottFam

customer_reviews.title: Very handy overall - misfeeds and binds with 2” brads
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing, and it is insanely cheap. However, the unit I got seems to have a magazine width on the low end of the tolerance. 2” brads barely fit into the magazine, and if you can get them in there, the magazine feed spring isn’t strong enough to overcome the friction between the brads and the magazine. This means you have to fire a brad, open the magazine, slam it shut hard enough to advance one brad, and repeat. I’ve tried loading the brads through the opposite side of the magazine, different brands of brads, oiling the magazine grooves - no luck. Still a great tool overall for the price, but QC not great.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Bonnell-Kangas

customer_reviews.title: Saves so much time and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've never had one of these and I can't believe how much faster and easier this makes putting trim up!!! Saved me so much time compared to hammering in those small finish nails! I plan to use this for other projects! If you already have an air compressor, do yourself a huge favor and put down the hammer and get one of these!! If you don't have an an air compressor, get one if those too!
customer_reviews.author: Marie Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Will save your time and energy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool, really what I was looking for. I was able to use this tool for many projects and it worked fine. So far all triggers fired without any issues. Case is an added bonus to store the tool safely from dropping or debris. I am also now looking for their stapler for an upcoming project, but they are currently out of stock. Was told will be available towards the end of June.
customer_reviews.author: o^V^o

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was super skeptical of a $25 air nailer but the reviews were positive. I only needed to install trim in my guest bedroom and would rather spend $25 than borrow a friend's nailer and risk damaging it. This thing worked beautifully! Used 2" SENCO nails to install trim and the depth of the nail set was perfect out of the box. Only ran about 125 nails through it, but no complaints. Can't believe I got something that works this well for only $25.
customer_reviews.author: Travis T.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have a stack of staplers and brad nailers I have tried, and after reading reviews I decided to give this cheap nailer a try, and I have been very impressed so far. As long as you stay on top of your oiling, this hasn't jammed yet, it drives brads straight and strong, and has honestly performed better than some of my much pricier tools. I recommend this to anyone. Amazing value
customer_reviews.author: Seth W

customer_reviews.title: Good nailer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my Bostitch kept jamming. I've remodeled my whole house and have used this to put all my trim up. It has held up really well so far and I have only had a few jams. It is easy to get it apart when it does jam up. My Bostitch worked great for about 4 years but the nail chute wore out. I have used this gun for about 4000 nails. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Can't Beat for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to trim bathroom and was a bit skeptical because of the price. Hooked to my Kobalt air compressor and it worked like a dream. Have done two other rooms and many small projects. You can spend a lot more, but for us, this works great. Has not jammed yet, but don't forget 3 drops of oil prior to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy B

customer_reviews.title: Durable, lightweight and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Have used this little brad nailer for a variety of household projects using wood or plastic surfaces. The nailer is more dependable than the Porter Cable nailers I had before and cost only a fraction of the cost. The reservoir holds a variety of nail sizes and, as long as you add pneumatic oil as needed (a couple drops covered over 50 1 1/2” nails last night), it has been consistent and dependable. Cannot beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bregales

customer_reviews.title: For the price, its second to none!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Dewalt 18g Brad nailer and I actually prefer to use my Wen. It’s built and designed well, works perfect and rarely jams. My only gripe with it is that it doesn’t come with a hook. It would be so much better if it came with a removable hook so you could hook it onto your belt. Besides that, it’s perfect and you simply cannot beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first nailer. It’s lightweight, and seems to be doing the job well. Occasionally it double-fires, and I wind up with two nails crammed together, but that’s the only problem I’ve had with it, and it seems to be related to how I press the trigger: all the double-fires have occurred when I tapped the trigger quicker than usual. Giving the trigger a full pull — til it hits its stop — seems to prevent double firing. I’m satisfied that this was a fine value for the price. It doesn’t look as sturdy as the Dewalts and Milwaukees I saw at the hardware store, but if you’re careful with your equipment, it seems this should be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Renaissance Bug

customer_reviews.title: I'm really digging WEN tools
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I am very impressed with the quality of this for the price. It's not a professional grade tool, but it is perfect for an occasional use around the house. This is my second WEN tool, the other is a bench top drll press. Both are great, reliable tools. I will buy more WEN tools in the future.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaVike

customer_reviews.title: Great for price...
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Used on numerous projects, not a single jam or malfunction when nailing. Little cranky with Porter Cable brand nails, sliding the cover shut was a bit off as if the nails were out of spec a bit and not laying in the rails correctly. Used different brands instead in different sizes (lengths) and no issues...
customer_reviews.author: Mav898989

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool for so small an amount.
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted this Brad Nailer. He was thrilled once I got it for him and he saved so much time on home projects, like attaching trim around our doors in our new home. He determined it took him half the time he would have spent using the traditional nail and hammer method. And the cost was terrific! This is highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Norwegiandogmom

customer_reviews.title: Great product, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product for the price. Our other nailer was on its way out and so we bought this nailer to take its place until we could find a battery operated nailer. This gun is so nice that I have decided to keep it on my bench and use it and my husband will get the battery operated nailer. This is not the first Wen product we have bought, we also bought a bench grinder and it is impressively built and a wonderful price.
customer_reviews.author: kate k

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for a few projects — until it didn’t. All of a sudden, in the middle of a frame, part of the inner spring exploded out the front. No obvious damage from outside the gun, but it stopped being able to shoot nails as intended... It’s always been kept in the box, well taken care of, never smashed around. Defective but of course I don’t have a warranty so I’m screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: This is the most economical priced brad nailer you can find. I drove about 100 brads and did not have a jam. It is my first time buying an air powered tool. Now that I have a compressor I am hooked. Can't go wrong at this price. If you just use it for one job it will pay for itself.
customer_reviews.author: AmaniSofia

customer_reviews.title: Summary: best nailer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Summary: best nailer for the price. I'm an American. As such, I'm used to getting what I pay for or less. Usually less. Much less. This nailer is an exception. It seems like it shouldn't be as good as it is, but it is. I've used it for a few months now. I've used the smaller gauge nails like pins to make standing birch plywood shelves. I drove 2 inch nails into braces for locust wood posts. And I just finished using it to drive 2" brad nails into a compost bin, into hard cedar and pressure treated 2 x 4s. Where there should be metal/aluminum, there is. A solid tool.
customer_reviews.author: David Squire

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I took the advice of others and purchased. I have used it for some light woodworking projects with success. I need to spend some time dialing in the pressure and depth, but so far so good. The only con, and this is a nit pick, is it’s heavier than expected. Working overhead might be strenuous, but ultimately I’m glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Edmond

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little gun
customer_reviews.text: This WEN 18 gauge brad nailer is very small, yet powerful enough to drive 2 inch brads through yellow pine with precision. I cannot say how it will work with hardwood, but I expect good performance. Everything about it seems like quality and good design for ease of use. Adjusting brad depth works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Cathey

customer_reviews.title: Big thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first.....but pleasantly surprised. I have shot a few hundred nails through it so far. For $26 dollars this has been an awesome pin nailer. I like how l can adjust how deep the nail is shot in, for the thickness of wood l am working with. The exhaust port is adjustable as well, so whatever position l am shooting the gun at l can adjust the exhaust away from me.
customer_reviews.author: Haveablast

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Works well and hasn't jammed.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Brad nailer. I have used it a fair amount in a home we purchased, mainly for trim work. I am not well versed on what guage should be used for what job, but this nailer has worked well for the projects I've completed. It is easy to learn to use, easy to load the Brad's, and has functioned well without jamming. I would recommend this product if you are looking for an 18 guage nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There have been no jams and it works great. I remodeled my sons room using this thing ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this thing almost daily since I got it. I do a lot of pallet crafts and projects. I have used every size of brad from 3/4" to 2". There have been no jams and it works great. I remodeled my sons room using this thing to install a pallet ceiling, pallet floor and trimmed the windows with pallet wood. I used this brad gun to install all the pallet wood just to see how well it worked. I am very happy with the results. Very comfortable to use. I wish it had a clip so I could attach it to my tool belt instead of having to put it down.
customer_reviews.author: RamFam

customer_reviews.title: Works for me out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in a hard shell case and works out of the box nailing in 3/4 inch plywood to 3/4 inch plywood for a 1.5 inch project (built in desk and cabinets). I am not a professional - just a home owner. I'll be using this every week I feel at home doing projects.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Burk

customer_reviews.title: Great Brad Gum
customer_reviews.text: What a neat little Brad nailer. I had a Dewalt for years which worked fine before I lost it in a divorce settlement. ( Don't ask)The Wren unit surpasses the Dewalt in my opinion . I am extremely satisfied. The depth adjustment is superior. I like opening the front of the unit to remove the clip. Very well done!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken P

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, doesn't jam.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to finish up some trim projects around the house. I had borrowed a larger named, larger gauged version from a friend for some projects and I liked this one much better! The other one jammed every 10 or so nails. I haven't had this one jam once. It's been perfect for what I needed. I expect a lot more projects in the future with this thing!
customer_reviews.author: bastrange

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.... Why spend more?
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted an air nailer but they were so expensive the HD and I didn't have enough uses to justify it. Well when I retrimmed me entire bedroom there was no way I was going to hand nail all of the trim. So I checked on Amazon and found this gem. Easy to use, load, easy to control depth, etc. Having the inexpensive but perfectly wonderful tool saved me hours.
customer_reviews.author: Carbonride

customer_reviews.title: GREAT deal, and the only way to go to install molding!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this baby, among the best $ I've ever spent! I used it to install quarter round molding on the new flooring job I did at home. In the old days, I would have used finishing nails and a hammer. What used to take me many minutes and many bruised fingers takes only seconds and my fingers stay healthy! Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.author: clyde714

customer_reviews.title: Cant believe the quality for the price! Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a brad nailer for a project I was doing. I purchased this because i have other WEN products and im happy with them all. The price was great. It works great. Even if this doesn't last long, for the price I would just get another but I have little doubt that I will get more than my money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: G. Warren

customer_reviews.title: perfect countersink
customer_reviews.text: Dropped in some brads and got nailing within 10 minutes of it arriving at my home. My first go was to test on a few pieces of scrap wood. Solid hold, perfectly countersunk. Off to the bath where I was finalizing the install of a kick board. Snap snap snap and she's done. The wife is even pleased.
customer_reviews.author: A. Radin

customer_reviews.title: First-time user, success!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a pneumatic tool before or a nail gun of any type. This was easy to set up and use. It came in a nice box with everything I needed to do my project. I trimmed out 2 windows and a set of French doors in no time and am about to do the rest of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl J.Top Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: I'm not carpenter
customer_reviews.text: I'm not carpenter but this made building some DIY pantry shelves very easy. Worked great. I think I only had one misfire/double feed but that could be do to the brads I bought and not the nailer. I would recommend this for any DIYer that needs and inexpensive nail gun.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: I own a cabinet shop. I've owned dozens of nail guns, they used to be American made and cost s few hundred. Now most are made in China, don't kid yourself thinking a Hitachi for 70 will be better than this gun. Fot the money you cannot beat this gun. This will be my third, other two are still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: DMW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. For $25ish dollars this cannot be beat. It requires some maintenance occasionally but it is WAY better quality than I was expecting. It operates around 80-90 psi for 1 1/4” nails. I built a speaker box with MDF with this thing in 1/2 hour. This is a no contest, no BS, tool. With this product you get way more than what you pay for. I imagine this to be one of those heirloom tools.
customer_reviews.author: Bissy&Bram

customer_reviews.title: Really good deal
customer_reviews.text: This was a good deal in my opinion. The nailer has good features some of which more expensive nailers don't have such as a depth ajustment. I'm a do it yourselfer so I haven't put this through any heavy duty trial but it works fine for my money and I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby D

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What was I waiting for?
customer_reviews.text: This nailer works great! Had a Porter-Cable I paid $120 for and fought it for years - the plunger would not retract and rebuild kits cost twice what the Wen nailer cost. This one is bullet-proof - anything I load it shoots without a problem. And if it starts to act up, I'll toss it and get another just like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all projects
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for a few months now and love it. This is my first nail gun and im very happy with it. I have used this to build doll furniture, add trim to nightstands, frame windows, replace baseboards in my bedrooms, and attach chair bottoms to frames after reupholstering. It is easy to use and we have never had a single problem with it. The carying case is nice as well for transporting or storing while not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in a good way
customer_reviews.text: This should cost more money for what you get. I shoe'd and capped a bedroom with no feeding issues. All nails shot in fine, no following up with a punch of anything. Comes with a hard case, not sure what else to say other than that it works the same as brad nailers that cost 2x or 3x more
customer_reviews.author: Shawn C. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Best brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased over 2 years ago. This brad nailer has our worked any brad nailer I’ve ever used before. Used it many many times and have never had it jam or miss-shoot one single time. Works amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: DeetsMit

customer_reviews.title: This us an excellent nailer.
customer_reviews.text: The nailer is working perfect out if the box. I have used different lengths of brads from 1” up to 2”. Some reviews claimed the instructions were not clear. Oil is one requirement and it is clear to me and they recommend to set air regulator at 50 to 60#. I set at 55 for 1 1/2” brad and it set to deep. Reset air pressure to 50# and just flush on the nail. Reset to 52# - Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Good according to a professional floor installer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product not realizing I needed a compressor (expensive!) to make it work. I hung on to it in case I ever bought a compressor for whatever reason. Then, a professional floor installer was working at my house and his nailer quit working. I offered this to him so he could keep working. He said it worked very well, so I guess that's a more informed opinion than mine!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R Griffin

customer_reviews.title: ... this tool to do a wood wall and worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this tool to do a wood wall and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: I'm Now Convinced As Well!
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat skeptical about this nailer, in spite of all the excellent reviews. Count me in now as a believer! I have been using this to shoot 1 1/2 inch brads into baseboard molding. I shot several brads into a piece of molding to see if I needed to make any adjustments. I used Hitachi 1 1/2 inch brads from Lowes with no problems. The brads sunk about 1/16 inch into the molding leaving just a small hole to fill with wood filler. I used an Amazon $25 gift card, so the gun cost me approximately $5. I think this is a great buy even at the standard $30 price.
customer_reviews.author: oibv305

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I took a gamble since the price was so low. Turned out to be an amazing bargain. Compares to the craftsmanship of nail guns 3 times the price in stores. I don't think I got a single jam putting up around 30 linear feet of 3ft beadboard, wainscoting railing, base molding, and a custom doorframe. It paid for itself multiple times in one job, and still works.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive about buying this nailer since it was a brand I have not heard of but after I received it I really liked and it was made with good quality materials and assembled very well. I never had any problems while using the gun and loaded easily. Really impressed for quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: amazon advocate

customer_reviews.title: Love the price, love the performance!
customer_reviews.text: This gun has been used on a flipping house plus more, every day for 6 months and still going strong. Only once the nail got stuck but it was more to do with the way the nails were inserted. Not bad for a $30 plus gun
customer_reviews.author: CMP

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent nail gun. I absolutely hate the color scheme. But functionality, size and operation I can't fault. I've driven 2in brads and 1in brads all without a miss fire. I was working with 3/4in oak veneer plywood and 3/4 oak solid stock. The depth setting on the top works well. It comes with a plastic clam shell style case with oil and a basic instruction manual. No nails are included. But the standard straight brads you can get at any big box store should work fine. I really like the gun to be honest and the price is definitely right.
customer_reviews.author: Diver165

customer_reviews.title: Great value, works great.
customer_reviews.text: What a time saver. I used the Brad nailer to install trim. It works great and am sure I will get years of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: my first brad nailer, so take this review for ...
customer_reviews.text: my first brad nailer, so take this review for what its worth.. Had some cheaper furniture to put backings on and the little nails always bend when using a hammer, so I ordered this tool after some research. fired off about 70 3/4" brads in no time, with no jams. It made a PITA job simple and quick. A big selling point for me was the depth adjustment lever under the trigger. a lot of the cheaper ones I saw just relied on adjusting the pressure at the compressor. For the price, features, light weight and performance you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: scatterbrn

customer_reviews.title: good for a cheap occasional usage
customer_reviews.text: nice build, seems like a really nice tool, however: it likes to double strike... a lot. if I take a little extra time and be extra careful I can reduce the occurrence, bottom line, for sticking things together while the glue dries, this is fine. for fine work like picture frames, get something in a higher price bracket.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jolley

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected now
customer_reviews.text: Nice cheap nailer. First one had a seized up depth adjusting wheel. Amazon shipped me a new one and I just had to drop this one off at the Amazon book store. They gave me all the normal options, but the easiest for me was dropping it off as I work just two blocks away from it.
customer_reviews.author: John Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: It's been a great nailer so far, and I've used it quite a bit to make wooden planters. Works just as good as any higher priced name brand. They're all plastic on the inside anyway.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: This tool is awesome. I’m not sure why anyone would pay 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool is awesome. I’m not sure why anyone would pay 5 times the amount for a dewalt nailer. I used this all weekend and it worked flawlessly. For the price you can buy 5 instead of one of the high end nailers.
customer_reviews.author: NYFisher

customer_reviews.title: WEN 61720 Brad-nailer...AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I don't leave may reviews, but I just had to for this item. It has made a huge impact on my woodworking projects allowing me to quickly glue up and tack together wood prior to running in some screws. I was originally nervous with buying a lower priced brad-gun, but had read many positive reviews on the WEN 61720 and took a chance. This tool is great...and not only for the price. For the budget-minded, this is one tool I will truly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SteveR

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I have replaced all the base molding in my home with this and it has worked very well. Be sure you buy a pack of nails with a wide assortment of sizes because it is hard to predict just what size is perfect for the job. For the price it has provided a great value and perfectly fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Wizengy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed after reading the glowing reviews. I installed trim this weekend, and about 50% of the time, the brad remained 1/4 to 2 inches outside of the wood. About 15% of the time, two nails were fired: one went in, and the other stuck out. Pressure was always in the 80 to 90 range, well within the 60 to 100 recommended. I played with the depth guage, and nothing worked. Different pressure on the trigger didn't matter either. It's caused me problems with the trim, and a lot of additional corrective work.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works and well made
customer_reviews.text: I like that for the price it does what the more expensive ones will do. Great for crown molding and baseboards. Using mine now for over 2 years. Used it on the door case I did, see the pics. Which was a crown on top of a 1x8 above the sliding window.
customer_reviews.author: knightridershop

customer_reviews.title: trigger will not activate
customer_reviews.text: It arrived next day from Amazon ... Great. Out of the box it would not fire. Appears the safety nose piece or something else is missing as the trigger will not engage the pin to release the air and drive the brad. Tried all adjustments and air settings. 3rd WEN tool while the others work great. Customer service was no help and sent me back thru Amazon. 2 stars for my other WEN tools.
customer_reviews.author: Red Motley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and you can not beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: I used this a few time to jangle wood paneling in my closet. For the price it’s amazing it has always worked and never jammed. You really can not go wrong. I even have a small compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Tomred

customer_reviews.title: I've read some of the bad reviews, and I know sometimes you just get ...
customer_reviews.text: I've read some of the bad reviews, and I know sometimes you just get a bad piece of equipment. I make a lot of my choices off reviews. I used this gun to put up shiplap in my bathroom. This gun worked like a Trooper! I only had one jam with a bad nail. Worked really well no miss fires. If you have small projects I would recommend this little gun for the price you can't beat it!!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Florez

product_meta.title: WEN 61720 3/4-Inch to 2-Inch 18-Gauge Brad Nailer
product_meta.description:
Style:Blue and Yellow ModelRemember when your brad nailer was reliable? The WEN 18-Gauge Brad Nailer effortlessly shoots brads anywhere from 3/4 to 2 inches in size. With a lightweight 3-pound aluminum body and a comfortable rubber-grip handle, this tool is the perfect companion for any job site. Just plug in your favorite air compressor and start nailing. The WEN Brad Nailer operates at anywhere from 60 to 100 PSI with a 1/4 inch NPT air inlet fitting. The spacious magazine carries up to 100 brads while the quick-release design makes jam clearing a breeze. The kit includes oil, adjustment wrenches and a custom carrying case for convenient storage between jobs. And it wouldn’t be a WEN product if it weren’t backed by a one year warranty, a friendly customer help line and a nationwide network of skilled service technicians. The WEN 18-Gauge Brad Nailer: remember when you could get through a job without your nailer constantly jamming up? Remember WEN.

AMAZON.COM
The 18-gauge brad nailer from WEN fires 18-gauge brads 3/4 to 2 inches in length. It features an adjustable exhaust deflector, a rubber-wrapped handle, a quick-release for jam-clearing, an aluminum body, and a magazine window that shows the remaining brad count. The magazine holds 100 brads, and the tool operates at 60-100 psi with a 1/4-inch NPT air inlet fitting. This kit includes oil, adjusting wrenches, and a custom carrying case.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Remember when your brad nailer was reliable? The WEN 18-Gauge Brad Nailer effortlessly shoots brads anywhere from 3/4 to 2 inches in size. With a lightweight 3-pound aluminum body and a comfortable rubber-grip handle, this tool is the perfect companion for any job site. Just plug in your favorite air compressor and start nailing. The WEN Brad Nailer operates at anywhere from 60 to 100 PSI with a 1/4 inch NPT air inlet fitting. The spacious magazine carries up to 100 brads while the quick-release design makes jam clearing a breeze. The kit includes oil, adjustment wrenches and a custom carrying case for convenient storage between jobs. And it wouldn’t be a WEN product if it weren’t backed by a one year warranty, a friendly customer help line and a nationwide network of skilled service technicians. The WEN 18-Gauge Brad Nailer: remember when you could get through a job without your nailer constantly jamming up? Remember WEN.

See more
feature_bullets: Fire brads from 3/4 to 2 inches in length
Operate at 60 to 100 PSI with a 1/4-inch NPT air inlet fitting
Lightweight aluminum body weighs in at 3 pounds with rubber-grip handle for maximum comfort
Hold up to 100 brads in the magazine with a quick-release to make jam clearing a breeze
Includes oil, two adjustment wrenches and a custom carrying case

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,516 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
